file_content.text: Good evening. Doctor Charnagus, at your service.
My, what a powerful collection of individuals you are. Impressive.
I've never had the pleasure of meeting a Jedi in person. Well, not one who was still alive.
I assume you've come to liberate your brothers in arms. That seems only fair.
The Empire clearly overestimated its security personnel. That, or you're a Jedi in disguise.
I've never met someone who could slaughter an entire facility alone. It's rather invigorating.
This seems an opportune moment to reveal that I am not Imperial. I merely work--ahem, worked--for them.
If you come along quietly, I'll take that into consideration.
Then surrender.
I'm honored to turn myself in to such a fair-minded person.
I'll withhold judgment until you reveal your purpose here.
Explain yourself.
A reasonable request I'll happily fulfill.
In my book, working for Imperials is the same as being one.
There's no difference.
I sympathize with your perspective, and I dearly wish to change it.
They, what, kidnapped your family? Planted explosives in your head?
Under duress, I assume.
Indeed. I was a prisoner of circumstance.
I'm done fighting.
Lovely to hear we can be friends. I enjoy meeting new people.
You'll die anyway.
Perhaps I can change your mind with a goodwill gesture?
Give me moment, and I'll revive the good Captain Trezin. I'm sure he's eager to speak with you.
What... what's going on?
You've been rescued. Isn't that wonderful?
Whoever you people are, thank you. Thought I was as dead as my crew.
Don't know how you pulled this off by yourself, but thanks. They killed everyone but me.
I freed Lieutenant Rale from Club Ufora. He sent me.
You're not the only survivor.
Glad he made it. What happened here was beyond horrifying.
They're all dead?
It was gruesome. I can't bear to think about it.
It happens.
But what they did here... it's inhuman.
This lunatic doctor has been tearing our bodies apart--grafting pieces onto Imperial spies so they look like us!
A combination of surgery and genetic splicing. Amazing procedure. I'm the first to successfully perform it.
Why did the Empire have you perform this "procedure" on our people?
For what purpose?
It was all part of a rather ingenious plan.
You disgust me.
It's not nearly as awful as you might think. The subjects feel no pain.
That is amazing.
Why, thank you. The Imperials were always quite stingy with their praise.
The Empire was secretly replacing Republic fleet officers with its own agents. Men enjoying their shore leave made perfect targets.
The Imperials wanted saboteurs throughout the Republic's warships. They planned to destroy the vessels from within.
From what Lieutenant Rale said, you've already replaced some of our people.
Those saboteurs are loose.
Yes, but they'll remain "sleepers" until they receive a signal to act. There's still plenty of time to apprehend them.
You seem to know a lot.
The facility's commander was quite forthcoming, at least with me.
Why doesn't the Republic ever come up with great plans like this?
Pretty clever.
I'd be happy to discuss it with them.
You deserve to die, monster.
Let's not be hasty. I'll gladly offer my expertise to the Republic. Think of all you could do.
To infiltrate the Empire? I... I guess I'd go along with using this filth.
The only thing we should do with this horrible man is lock him away.
The doctor belongs in prison.
You're right, of course. I'm--I'm not thinking too clearly right now.
Oh, dear. You people are passing up a golden opportunity.
I'll escort this sicko to my superiors for punishment. Thanks for all your help.
See that this man pays for his crimes.
Let justice be served.
You can count on that, Master Jedi. Goodbye.
I'm glad you stayed true to the Republic's ideals.
You're a good man, Captain.
It's what my men would've wanted. Goodbye, Master Jedi.
If you need someone to say "fire" at his execution, call me.
Escort him to a firing squad.
Will do, sir.
I hope you do more to that doctor than take away his license.
He deserves whatever he gets.
There's never enough punishment for men like him. Goodbye.
My pleasure.
Goodbye.
I want to be famous for this.
I won't forget any of you.
I won't forget you.
He may be sick, but we need men like him to fight the Empire.
Let's work with the doctor.
I wish that didn't make so much sense.
Splendid. As this facility is no longer suitable, I recommend we move somewhere else.
I'll escort this "doctor" to my superiors and recommend we use him. Thanks for the help, I guess.
If we can turn their weapons against them, the Empire will fall.
You're doing what's best.
I hope that's true.
Trust my wisdom, soldier. This is how we'll defeat the Sith.
You're doing what's best.
I'll try to remember that, Master Jedi.
Keep your conscience clear, soldier. This is the right call.
You're doing what's best.
Yes, sir.
Sometimes you have to play dirty. Don't let it bother you.
You're doing what's best.
I'll try not to.
Have fun--see you around.
I hope we're doing the right thing....
I want to be famous for this.
You'll all be mentioned in my report. Goodbye.
You'll be mentioned in my debriefing report. Goodbye.
